Attempting to ftp causes hang with this sort of setup:
   <ftp action="list"
         server="${host}"
         port="21"
         userid="${uname}"
         password="${pass}"
         depends="yes"
         binary="yes"
         verbose="yes"
         listing="foo.txt" >
      <fileset dir="/a/b/c${d}/e/f">
        <filename name="a_b.log"/>
        <date datetime="YESTERDAY" when="after"/>
      </fileset>
    </ftp>

This is FTP from Windows to UNIX box.
Severity = major since it probably shouldn't just hang.

text:
After further use of ant, I believe this is more of a documentation bug.

remotedir - the directory to which to upload files on the ftp server. 

From experience, remotedir also specifies where to download files on the ftp 
server.  The "dir" attribute of <fileset> actually specifies where the files 
will go.  The <filename> "name" attribute is appended to remotedir to come up 
with the final path.

I am also seeing hangs, but they are not repeatable.  Soemtimes it hangs and
sometimes it doesn't on the same task.  I'm running ANT 1.5.3 via Eclipse 2.1.
